Skill Sets



ORIGINAL RESEARCH

Managing research project and solving problems with original ideas

Studying for a PhD is more than sitting in a classroom and listening to lectures. The majority of the PhD study involves project work that aims at creating publications.

From start to finish, each project involves brainstorming ideas, analytic calculation, coding algorithms, statistical analysis of data, meeting and collaboration, academic writing and response to peer review.




STATISTICS & MATHEMATIC

Analyzing data with mathematical methods and statistical tools

Advanced mathematics for solving physics problems: linear algebra, multidimensional calculus, ordinary and partial differential equations, group theory, differential geometry, etc.

Statistical methods for comparing theoretical prediction to experiment data Probability theory, statistical inference, hypothesis testing, Markov-chain Monte Carlo (MCMC), and Bayesian and frequentist statistics.

Coding programs to analyze big data and visualize the results

Firmware: VHDL, Verilog
